tasks.task: Drive a tractor to plant seeds.
subtasks: Sit on the tractor seat.
Operate the tractor's steering wheel to navigate the field.
Engage the tractor's power takeoff (PTO) to run the planter.
Monitor the planter's mechanics while driving.
Adjust direction as needed to maintain proper planting rows.

tasks.task: Operate a planter attachment on the tractor.
subtasks: Assemble the planter’s seed boxes and seed plates.
Load seeds into the seed boxes.
Attach the seed plates to the planter's openers.
Connect the planter's seed tubes to the seed box and seed plate.
Check that all parts are secure and properly aligned.

tasks.task: Load fertilizer into the tractor's fertilizer tank.
subtasks: Open the fertilizer tank access door.
Securely attach a measuring cup or scoop to the tank.
Pour the correct amount of fertilizer into the tank.
Close the access door and ensure it is tightly sealed.
Drive the sprayer to the field.
Prime the sprayer's pumps.
Mix the appropriate water and chemicals in the sprayer tank.
Adjust spray nozzles for the desired pattern and coverage.
Drive through the field, ensuring even distribution of water.

tasks.task: Check the soil moisture before planting.
subtasks: Walk through the field to observe soil conditions.
Use a hand tool or meter to measure soil moisture levels.
Document areas needing irrigation or adjusting planting times.
Use a tablet or clipboard to record observations.
Note soil type, weed presence, or other critical factors.
Input data into the farm management system.
Contact the cooperative regarding supplies or services.
Provide necessary information about required products or schedules.
Receive feedback or updates from the cooperative.
Drive the tillage equipment to break up the soil.
Guide the equipment to cover the desired area.
Monitor the tillage depth and uniformity.
Level the soil using a finisher disk or similar tool.
Perform a final pass with the tractor to smooth the field.
